item.title: Rubbish in the alleyway adjacent to property of 95 Eglinton Road., 4th September
item.description:
This problem was previously reported in June and nothing was done about it. Since then it has become progressively worse as there are now more black bags and a box full of rubbish. This area has become a dumping ground. Could we have these rubbish bags removed please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 169, Eglinton Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Can't walk on pavement, 4th September
item.description:
The hedges from the retirement home have overgrown onto the street and is forcing pedestrians to walk in the road. It's been like this for about 6 months now and goes all the way from the start of the home till the end of street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tower Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drains, 4th September
item.description:
Rain causing floods everywhere our drains need cleaning

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 142, Avery Hill Road, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The signs encouraging :"Dog owners to clean up after their dogs". Some of these have been pulled down!, 4th September
item.description:
The signs encouraging :"Og owners to clean up after their dogs". Some of these have been pulled down! This is especially so in Fernhead Road, and Shirland Road. Some dog owners don't like to be told what to do! These signs have been pulled down to the level of the pavement. Whilst others have been turned over to face the opposite direction! These signs could however, be perhaps fastened more securely to the post that they have been fastened to. Thank you in anticipation. I am always grateful to Westminster for your response to the horrible inconsiderate dog owners who do not clean up after their dogs. Keep up with the good work because it is greatly appreciated.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 97, Fernhead Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hall Road, St. John's Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rotting fruit, 4th September
item.description:
Fallen fruit from public tree is causing fruit flies in my house. I have young children and the volume of fruit flies due to the rotting fruit is crazy. The rotting fruit is on the road and my garden. Could you please clear up the fruit mess and also trim the tree so that it does not overhang my garden and drop fruit? Thank you Russ

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 98, Village Way, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Stray Cat, 4th September
item.description:
There is a stray cat under the footbridge, it has been there for some time now. Can you please get someone to trap her as it's not a safe location next to the A12
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Chapman Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Still a small amount of dog fouling on the pavement which is in front of 95 Fernhead Road., 4th September
item.description:
There is still a small amount of dog fouling on the pavement which is in front of 95 Fernhead Road. This was reported to you yesterday afternoon. The fouling is in the middle of the pavement. Thank you in anticipation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 97, Fernhead Road, Kensal Town, London

item.title: St George's flags raised on all lamp posts, 4th September
item.description:
The current raise the colours flag movement was started by people who have links to the EDL and other far-right groups. These do not represent British values of tolerance. I do not feel comfortable with them being outside by house or my child's school.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Footscray Road, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog waste, 4th September
item.description:
Overhill Road is full of dog waste , from top to bottom . Moved on this road 2 years ago and it’s always disgusting to walk along . I have 2 young children on scooters , pram wtc and I have to check the road ahead while I’m walking . dog owners don’t pick up the waste from the road ! Needs more signs and road cleaners . Also the right side of overhill road doesn’t get swept 🧹 by the cleaners . This year we had the right side of the pavement cleaned once and that’s because of the leafs . Best regards Alex
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Overhill Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light still not fixed, 4th September
item.description:
Elderly neighbour is scared to leave her house because it’s so dark. She can’t see where she is going. Can’t see properly when driving. It’s dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Beverley Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
